page.title: 19Changing Times, Kinbrace
page.content: At the beginning of the century many people worked during the summer months in the shooting lodges_butlers, footmen,ladiesmaids, housemaids, cooks,kitchen_maids and gardeners. All these people were employed because wages were so very low. Many people were employed on the railway_a station-master,porters and surfacemen. There were no motor cars to take people elsewhere for entertainment so they danced to fiddle music and enjoyed concerts in the local hall_ an ex-army hut which was erected there after the war. There were musical evenings too in the houses. On Saturday nights the young folks met at the local shop and had fun. On Sundays people walked miles to attend church and the churches were full.
